lead_paragraph: Antigovernment activists in the city were sending increasingly desperate messages about being killed or arrested, and civilians called for safe passage out.

byline.contributor: Hwaida Saad contributed reporting from Beirut, and Gardiner Harris from Washington.

headline.print_headline: Syrian Troops Are Said to Drive Deeper Into Rebel Areas of Aleppo
headline.main: In Rebel-Held Aleppo, Residents Report Increasing Desperation

snippet: Antigovernment activists in the city were sending increasingly desperate messages about being killed or arrested, and civilians called for safe passage out....
abstract: Syrian government forces make gains in taking back city of Aleppo, advancing into Old City, where rebel groups have long taken cover; rebel leaders dispute how far government forces have advanced, but antigovernment activists make it clear they are increasingly concerned about being killed or arrested.
